headline: U.S. Government Backs Constellation’s Plan to Launch Crane Clean Energy Center, Adding 835 MWs of New Baseload Power to the Grid
summary: LONDONDERRY, Pa., November 18, 2025--Constellation announced today that its Crane Clean Energy Center is now backed by a $1 billion U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) loan.

content.title: U.S. Government Backs Constellation’s Plan to Launch Crane Clean Energy Center, Adding 835 MWs of New Baseload Power to the Grid
content.summary: LONDONDERRY, Pa., November 18, 2025--Constellation announced today that its Crane Clean Energy Center is now backed by a $1 billion U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) loan.

headline: U.S. Backs $1 Billion Loan to Restart the Three Mile Island Nuclear Plant
summary: The Trump Administration will give  Constellation Energy  a $1 billion federal loan to restart the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania that suffered a partial core meltdown in 1979.  Energy Secretary  Chris Wright  said Tuesday that restarting the plant will help bring down electricity prices and that the administration will act to bring more nuclear generation online.  Constellation announced last year that it would restart the Three Mile Island site of the country’s worst nuclear power accident, to help generate electricity for  Microsoft  which needs more power to fuel its artificial intelligence business.
